description.value:
Rite of the Questing Stone
Mystic Rite • Level 2

Time: 1 hour
Cost: 3 Gnosis
Requirement: A small stone, charm, or personal token, and a clearly defined quarry

Description

The Rite of the Questing Stone binds a minor spirit of guidance into a token, allowing it to subtly pull toward a chosen quarry. The spirit does not reveal paths or destinations outright; instead, it provides instinctive direction, nudging the bearer toward what they seek.

This Rite does not replace the hunt. It ensures the hunt is not blind.

Effect

When the Gnosis cost is paid, the Rite succeeds automatically.

Choose one of the following quarries at the time of performance:

  • A specific creature personally known to the Garou
  • A specific object the Garou has seen or handled
  • A clearly described location of spiritual or narrative significance

For the next 24 hours, the questing stone provides the bearer with a general sense of direction toward the quarry.

This guidance functions as follows:

  • The bearer always knows the approximate direction of the quarry (north, south-east, downward, etc.)
  • The Rite does not reveal: distance; obstacles; exact location
  • The guidance updates naturally as the bearer moves

Mechanical Benefits

While following the questing stone's guidance, the bearer has advantage on:

  • Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track or navigate toward the quarry
  • Wisdom (Perception) checks made to notice signs or traces related to the quarry

These benefits apply only when actively pursuing the chosen quarry.

Limitations

This Rite:

  • Cannot target an unknown or vaguely defined quarry
  • Does not penetrate planar boundaries
  • Does not bypass powerful magic that conceals location
  • If the quarry is destroyed, unreachable, or protected by powerful warding, the guidance becomes vague or ceases (Storyteller adjudication)
  • A Garou may only have one active questing stone at a time

End of Effect

The Rite ends early if:

  • The quarry is found
  • The bearer willingly abandons the hunt
  • The 24-hour duration expires

The stone then becomes mundane once more.

"The stone does not tell you where to go. It reminds you which way is forward."
